cards.title: Atkins Ciwem environmental photographer of the year 2015 winners
cards.rawTitle: Atkins Ciwem environmental photographer of the year 2015 winners

item.title: Atkins Ciwem environmental photographer of the year 2015 winners
item.trailText: The winning photograph of two watermelon farmers in West Bengal, India will feature alongside over 100 photographic artworks in a display at the Royal Geographical Society in London from 22 June - 10 July 2015. The exhibition will then tour UK forest venues, supported by the Forestry Commission England, including Grizedale Forest visitor centre, Cumbria, 18 July-7 September
item.standFirst: The winning photograph of two watermelon farmers in West Bengal, India will feature alongside over 100 photographic artworks in a display at the Royal Geographical Society in London from 22 June - 10 July 2015. The exhibition will then tour UK forest venues, supported by the Forestry Commission England, including Grizedale Forest visitor centre, Cumbria, 18 July-7 September

displayImages.caption:
Winner of the Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year 2015: Uttam Kamati with ‘Watering Melon’
Kamati’s winning photo depicts a husband and wife watering watermelon saplings on the Teesta river bed, in West Bengal, India. Kamati is an amateur photographer and filmmaker from India, who captures the work of humanitarian projects, transforming these endeavours into candid, touching scenes Photograph: Uttam Kamati/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.credit: Uttam Kamati/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.altText: The Atkins CIWEM Environmental Photographer of the Year is awarded to Uttam Kamati for his inspiring image ‘Watering Melon’. Kamati’s winning image depicts a husband and wife watering watermelon saplings on the Teesta river bed, in West Bengal, India. Kamati is an amateur photographer and filmmaker from India, who captures the work of humanitarian projects, transforming these endeavours into candid, touching scenes.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Winner of the Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year 2015: Uttam Kamati with ‘Watering Melon’
Kamati’s winning photo depicts a husband and wife watering watermelon saplings on the Teesta river bed, in West Bengal, India. Kamati is an amateur photographer and filmmaker from India, who captures the work of humanitarian projects, transforming these endeavours into candid, touching scenes
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Uttam Kamati/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year

displayImages.caption:
Winner of the Atkins Ciwem Young Environmental Photographer of the Year 2015: Bhar Dipayan with ‘Families are living under the Bridge’
Dipayan works in Kolkata, India, and has been a photographer for four years, slowly building up recognition in his own country and abroad for his intimate images of daily life in the developing world Photograph: Dipayan Bhar/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.credit: Dipayan Bhar/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.altText: The Atkins CIWEM Young Environmental Photographer of the Year 2015 prize has been awarded to Bhar Dipayan’s thought- provoking image ‘Families are living under the Bridge’. Dipayan works in Kolkata, India, and has been a photographer for four years, slowly building up recognition in his own country and abroad for his intimate images of daily life in the developing world.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Winner of the Atkins Ciwem Young Environmental Photographer of the Year 2015: Bhar Dipayan with ‘Families are living under the Bridge’
Dipayan works in Kolkata, India, and has been a photographer for four years, slowly building up recognition in his own country and abroad for his intimate images of daily life in the developing world
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Dipayan Bhar/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year

displayImages.caption:
Winner of the Atkins Cityscape Prize: Michael Theodoric with ‘Enjoy’
The image shows a man enjoying the view of Jakarta from his hotel room Photograph: Michael Theodoric /2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.credit: Michael Theodoric /2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.altText: The Atkins Cityscape Prize is awarded to Michael Theodoric for his arresting image  ‘Enjoy’, which shows a man enjoying the view of Jakarta from his hotel room.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Winner of the Atkins Cityscape Prize: Michael Theodoric with ‘Enjoy’
The image shows a man enjoying the view of Jakarta from his hotel room
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Michael Theodoric /2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year

displayImages.caption:
Winner of the Forestry Commission England Exhibition Award: Esme Allen for her series entitled ‘Eden Restored - The Mesopotamian Marshes of Iraq’
The marshes were drained by Saddam Hussein, forcing their inhabitants to flee to neighbouring countries. They were not only home to the Marsh Arabs but also to a huge variety of birds and wildlife. After Saddam’s downfall local people smashed part of the dam walls and the water once again covered the dry land; many of the Marsh Arabs have now returned to live in a traditional way on the water Photograph: Esme Allen/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.credit: Esme Allen/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.altText: Esme Allen has been awarded the Forestry Commission England Exhibition Award for her series entitled ‘Eden Restored - The Mesopotamian Marshes of Iraq’. The marshes were drained by Saddam Hussein, forcing their inhabitants to flee to neighbouring countries. They were not only home to the Marsh Arabs but also to a huge variety of birds and wildlife. After Saddam's downfall local people smashed part of the dam walls and the water once again covered the dry land; many of the Marsh Arabs have now returned to live in a traditional way on the water.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Winner of the Forestry Commission England Exhibition Award: Esme Allen for her series entitled ‘Eden Restored - The Mesopotamian Marshes of Iraq’
The marshes were drained by Saddam Hussein, forcing their inhabitants to flee to neighbouring countries. They were not only home to the Marsh Arabs but also to a huge variety of birds and wildlife. After Saddam’s downfall local people smashed part of the dam walls and the water once again covered the dry land; many of the Marsh Arabs have now returned to live in a traditional way on the water
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Esme Allen/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year

displayImages.caption:
Winner of the Atkins Ciwem Environmental Film of the Year: Verity White, Ren Kyst - Got a spare afternoon?, Norway, 2014
The film still courtesy the photographer and Atkins CIWEM Environmental Photographer of the Year Photograph: 2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
displayImages.credit: 2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year

image.caption:
Winner of the Forestry Commission England Exhibition Award: Esme Allen for her series entitled ‘Eden Restored - The Mesopotamian Marshes of Iraq’
The marshes were drained by Saddam Hussein, forcing their inhabitants to flee to neighbouring countries. They were not only home to the Marsh Arabs but also to a huge variety of birds and wildlife. After Saddam’s downfall local people smashed part of the dam walls and the water once again covered the dry land; many of the Marsh Arabs have now returned to live in a traditional way on the water Photograph: Esme Allen/2015 Atkins Ciwem Environmental Photographer of the Year
